Writing data options

Writing data options

Examples

(x <- HttpClient$new(url = "https://httpbin.org"))
#> <crul connection> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org
#>   curl options: 
#>   proxies: 
#>   headers: 

# write to disk
(x <- HttpClient$new(url = "https://httpbin.org"))
#> <crul connection> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org
#>   curl options: 
#>   proxies: 
#>   headers: 
f <- tempfile()
res <- x$get(disk = f)
res$content # when using write to disk, content is a path
#> [1] "/var/folders/gs/4khph0xs0436gmd2gdnwsg080000gn/T//RtmpDRNgyG/file70ed714098f"
readLines(res$content)
#> Warning: incomplete final line found on '/var/folders/gs/4khph0xs0436gmd2gdnwsg080000gn/T//RtmpDRNgyG/file70ed714098f'

#>  [94] "<li><a href=\"/range/1024\"><code>/range/1024?duration=s&amp;chunk_size=code</code></a> Streams <em>n</em> bytes, and allows specifying a <em>Range</em> header to select a subset of the data. Accepts a <em>chunk_size</em> and request <em>duration</em> parameter.</li>"

#> [113] "<h2 id=\"DESCRIPTION\">DESCRIPTION</h2>"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
#> [114] ""                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
#> [115] "<p>Testing an HTTP Library can become difficult sometimes. <a href=\"http://requestb.in\">RequestBin</a> is fantastic for testing POST requests, but doesn't let you control the response. This exists to cover all kinds of HTTP scenarios. Additional endpoints are being considered.</p>"
#> [116] ""                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
#> [117] "<p>All endpoint responses are JSON-encoded.</p>"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
#> [118] ""

#> [120] ""                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
#> [121] "<h3 id=\"-curl-http-httpbin-org-ip\">$ curl http://httpbin.org/ip</h3>"

#> [125] ""

#> [185] "<h2 id=\"Installing-and-running-from-PyPI\">Installing and running from PyPI</h2>"                                                                                                                                                                                                          
#> [186] ""                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
#> [187] "<p>You can install httpbin as a library from PyPI and run it as a WSGI app.  For example, using Gunicorn:</p>"                                                                                                                                                                              
#> [188] ""                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
#> [189] "<pre><code class=\"bash\">$ pip install httpbin"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
#> [190] "$ gunicorn httpbin:app"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
#> [191] "</code></pre>"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
#> [192] ""

# streaming response
(x <- HttpClient$new(url = "https://httpbin.org"))
#> <crul connection> 
#>   url: https://httpbin.org
#>   curl options: 
#>   proxies: 
#>   headers: 
res <- x$get('stream/50', stream = function(x) cat(rawToChar(x)))
